website_summaries.verdict: As a lightweight, durable model, the Classic Harman Run from Reebok sneakers offers everything one needs for everyday style. There are many colors for different style preferences, and the shoe's looks have earned much acclaim from wearers, especially its classic appeal.Aside from that, it also offers comfort, support, and traction in good measure. This budget-friendly model can be an attractive choice for one’s closet.
pros: The Reebok Classic Harman Run is budget-friendly
It’s a lightweight model, a few purchasers have praised
A lot of users attest that the Reebok Classic Harman Run offers a comfortable feel
Most reviewers reveal that they will recommend this shoe from the Reebok Classics collection
The sneaker has a stylish design, many wearers have commended, calling it neat, old-school, and classic
According to several buyers, the Reebok Classic Harman Run is durable and of excellent quality
Some users share that they will buy the model again
The Reebok Classic Harman Run has a cushiony sole, more than a handful of reviewers have perceived
A couple of wearers have shared that the sneaker delivers good traction
cons: According to a couple of testers, the shoe doesn’t provide enough arch support for extended wearing
Several purchasers feel that the Reebok Classic Harman Run fits too wide

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised. Sweet new treads love green
customer_reviews.text: Awesome comfy kicks.cool Classic look, I have a wider foot , but they’re still comfy for long walks to the liquor store.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Platinum Member

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these to work in.
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely ridiculous. I bought this shoe to work in Bc I walk and run a lot as a mail carrier. Um...NO. I don’t see how this even qualifies as a running shoe. 3 thumbs down 👎🏾👎🏾👎🏾. This shoe is worn out and run over as if I’ve had them for 3 years. It’s only been a month or so. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Brina Renee

customer_reviews.title: Style and Fit
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe and the color combination. I am a female and I tend to like men’s style sneakers and they look smaller on my feet, as I wear a woman size 10. I did get an 8.5 in the men size, as that would be the size in comparison. I may have been able to take an 8, as I had a little room in my toe top part in the 8.5. I figure if I have socks on then the fit will be fine, as it’s not unfitting with no socks. I plan to get this brand in others styles as well.
customer_reviews.author: Charla

customer_reviews.title: Reeboks are comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The Reeboks are extremely comfortable and supportive with modern insoles in already comfortable classic footwear. They also have a very nice and comfortable lining and tongue and they are light, flexible and super quiet while walking on hard surfaces and the dragged soles are excellent on dirt, rocks and gravel. They seem to be as good quality as Reebok has ever been. Size fits as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Haztive Dominicana

customer_reviews.title: Love the Classic Reebok's
customer_reviews.text: The Reebok Harman Runs are extremely comfortable and supportive with the modern insoles in the already comfortable classic shoe. They also have a very nice and comfortable sock liner and tongue and they are light, flexible and super quiet while walking hard surfaces and the lugged soles are great in dirt, rocks and gravel. They seem to be just as great of quality as Reebok has always been which IMHO is one of the best in the business. I have worn all kinds of Reeboks over the decades and they remain my favorite brand in comfort and durability. The size fit just as expected. And yes people these are 100% real Reeboks. :)
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Stiff sole
customer_reviews.text: People stated in their reviews that these are comfy shoes. While they look cool and retro, the sole is unbendable and super stiff and standing in them for long periods of time will hurt your feet. For some people, this may work, but for me it doesn't. If I keep them, they will be worn during casual times when I'm not on my feet working or working out. This is more looks over function shoe. I do not recommend walking or running in this. Your ankles and heels will suffer. I am considering sending it back or giving it to my mother. It might work for her.
customer_reviews.author: Stance Is Everything

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and look great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specific colors because they match my sports team. And at a much better cost. They are very comfortable. Im on my feet all day. Probably one of the best pair of shoes I have owned in a while. Easy to get on and off and they fit great. and have extra room so your feet don't sweat. very nice design. I will be purchasing the same pair again.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Best Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These are the 4th pair I've had in a few years. They hold up nicely and the white, blue and yellow is a nice bright colorway. These are always the most comfortable shoes for me to wear, since Reebok doesn't make them for slim-footed alien people. I have lots of room and they fit as expected. Reebok is about the only athletic/casual shoe i've worn for a few years now. New pair of socks with these and it's one of those small pleasures.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and fits as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Reeboks for more years than I can count. I love them but these blue gel inserts they started putting in a couple years ago are not my thing. They get holes in them quickly and I end up buying a new pair of shoes every 3 months. There should be an option of having the new gel insert or the original.
customer_reviews.author: Geckos to the Max

customer_reviews.title: Lite and comfortable for walking/running
customer_reviews.text: Purchased men size 4(blk and blu)for my daughter, $18. VS kids female size 3(blk and wht) also for my daughter, $58. Both shoes looks alike, comfortable, lite and great for walk/run. The only difference is the price! I wore these models of Reebok in grade school, Jr High, H.S, college and now still wearing these same models because of comfort. Daughter loves it! 😍
customer_reviews.author: Yahh0o

customer_reviews.title: CLASSIC KICKS, BUT A BIT TIGHT FYI
customer_reviews.text: Just a heads up, for those with big feet (size 15 here) these fit a bit tight if you happen to be familiar with the sizing and width of a New Balance 574 — New Balance is one shoe brand that’s good for offering us with extra large sizes so I imagine many of you who’ve found an option here in Reebok’s classic. I have a slender profiled insole and it’s taken about a month to get them to break in.. wish they had a wide option. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Johnson

customer_reviews.title: comfortable quality kicks
customer_reviews.text: Scored a pair of these for $38. Went for the deal instead of the precise color I wanted. They are legit Reebok, very well crafted shoe. They look so good, I almost don't want to wear them and get dirty 'em lol
customer_reviews.author: Harold Torres

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the classic look
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are a classic. The design is timeless and it fits true to size. Very comfortable to wear. If you get them in white, I would suggest to get some shoe cleaner as they definitely attract dirt quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Noel

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t look right on footb
customer_reviews.text: Don’t like how they site on my foot. The Reebok Classic the white leather with gum bottom are the best

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about them!
customer_reviews.text: They are gorgeous and fits as expected, i purchased 2 pairs for my girls and they both love them,if you wear 7.5 in female get 5.5. They super cute .

customer_reviews.title: Good ortho light shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I feel the seller should say that these are orthopedic shoes. Or at least ortho light. Its not a problem but because of that they do run larger and wider so they seem bulky. For me I wear them to work and stand all day so it's ok but I feel like a lot of people could benefit from knowing they are not regular sneakers
customer_reviews.author: bryan l.

customer_reviews.title: Correct size and fit
customer_reviews.text: The size stated is about a 12M depending on where and who is the making the shoe. Don't get me wrong as they fit me. I love Reeboks and order when I need that type of shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Rising Sun

customer_reviews.title: Love them!!
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a Reebok Fan since the 90s! I'm Glad they bring them back!! This color is amazing!! Military Green and white Gum bottoms!!! AWESOME!!!!

customer_reviews.title: Good wide width shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have type 1 daibetes so my nevers are shot plus my right foot had surgery so its a bit larger so i need a wide with. That being said i enjoy these shoes they are a bit wider than most

As usually, this shoes perfectly fit to my size and match its quality. Moreover, it's even arrived earlier than it was expected. I would love to order another design soon.

customer_reviews.text: Fit is a tad big which leads to some heel slippage. Insoles are INSANELY COMFY!

customer_reviews.title: Solid waterproof shoe
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the way it looked. The toe box is big. I work as a PE teacher and deal with wet grass soaking through my shoes. This shoe does a great job keeping the wetness out. One thing I wish it had more cushion support, but overall a pretty good shoe.

customer_reviews.text: These shoes appear to run a half size small. I normally wear a size 11 with perfect toe room. Another pair of Reebok classics I have are an 11 and feel a half size too big, which I can deal with. I may have to return these after I sleep on it.

product_meta.title: Reebok Men's Classic Harman Run Sneaker
product_meta.description: Reebok was founded for one of the best reasons possible: athletes wanted to run faster. So in the 1890s, joseph william Foster made some of the first known running shoes with spikes in them. By 1895, he was in business making shoes by hand for top runners; and before long his fledgling company, j.W. Foster and sons, developed an international clientele of distinguished athletes.
